# Linux Command Cheat Sheet

## Navigation

- `cd [directory]`: Change directory
- `pwd`: Print working directory
- `ls`: List directory contents
- `ls -l`: List directory contents with details
- `ls -a`: List directory contents, including hidden files
- `ls -lh`: List directory contents with long format and human-readable file sizes

## File Operations

- `touch [filename]`: Create an empty file
- `cp [source] [destination]`: Copy file or directory
- `mv [source] [destination]`: Move or rename file or directory
- `rm [file]`: Remove file
- `rm -r [directory]`: Remove directory and its contents recursively
- `cat [file]`: Display file contents
- `less [file]`: View file contents one page at a time
- `head [file]`: Display the beginning of a file
- `tail [file]`: Display the end of a file
- `grep [pattern] [file]`: Search for a pattern in a file
- `wc [file]`: Count lines, words, and characters in a file

## System Information

- `uname -a`: Show system information
- `whoami`: Print current user name
- `date`: Display the current date and time
- `cal [month] [year]`: Display calendar for a specific month and year

## Process Management

- `ps`: Display running processes
- `ps aux`: Display all running processes with details
- `top`: Monitor system processes in real-time
- `kill [PID]`: Terminate a process by its process ID

## Network

- `ifconfig`: Display network interface information
- `ping [host]`: Send ICMP echo requests to a host
- `wget [URL]`: Download a file from the web
- `curl [URL]`: Transfer data to or from a server

## Package Management

- `apt-get update`: Update package lists
- `apt-get install [package]`: Install a package
- `apt-get remove [package]`: Remove a package
- `apt-get upgrade`: Upgrade all installed packages

## Compression

- `tar -czvf [archive.tar.gz] [files/directories]`: Create a gzip-compressed tar archive
- `tar -xzvf [archive.tar.gz]`: Extract files from a gzip-compressed tar archive

## Permissions

- `chmod [permissions] [file/directory]`: Change permissions of a file or directory
- `chown [user:group] [file/directory]`: Change ownership of a file or directory

## Miscellaneous

- `history`: Show command history
- `man [command]`: Display manual page for a command
- `sudo [command]`: Execute a command with superuser privileges
- `clear`: Clear the terminal screen
